DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Features Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Score that represents the type of skin features associated with chronic graft vs. host disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Feature National Institutes of Health Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages._A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest._A federal agency in the U.S. that conducts biomedical research in its own laboratories; supports the research of non-Federal scientists in universities, medical schools, hospitals, and research institutions throughout the country and abroad; helps in the training of research investigators; and fosters communication of medical information. Access the National Institutes of Health Web site at http://www.nih.gov._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Features Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.: The ability to move with ease and without restriction.

Concepts.definition: Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.
The ability to move with ease and without restriction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formation or development of an ulcer.

Concepts.definition: The formation or development of an ulcer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Skin that is abnormally dry and stiff, lacking pliancy and closely adhered to the underlying flesh.

Concepts.definition: Skin that is abnormally dry and stiff, lacking pliancy and closely adhered to the underlying flesh.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Extending relatively far inward.: A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.: A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.

Concepts.definition: A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.
A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of little substance or significance; involving only a surface.: A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.: A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.

Concepts.definition: Of little substance or significance; involving only a surface.
A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.
A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.: A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.: A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.
A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Presence of any or all of the following: deep sclerotic features, hidebound, impaired mobility, ulceration

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
